findings.title: Reward Token Draining by Owner
findings.description: The contract owner can drain the reward from the SweetVault contract by manipulating the router and stealing the reward tokens without any restriction.

findings.title: Improper Usage of SafeERC20.safeApprove()
findings.description: Using safeApprove() function can lead to an unfulfilled condition making some functions unusable due to depletion of approval amount.

findings.title: Unchecked Swapping Path Setting
findings.description: The unchecked path can cause the reward token to be incorrectly swapped, causing the pool to have no reward.

findings.title: Improper Reward Transfer Amount Calculation
findings.description: The users may gain a higher amount of $PACOCA than the actual amount of reward claimed due to improper calculation of transfer amount.

findings.title: Dangerous Approval to External Contract
findings.description: The external contracts can steal all approved tokens from the SweetVault contract; however, for normal usage, no token will be left unattended in the SweetVault contract.

findings.title: Potential Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: The controlling authorities can change the critical state variables to gain additional profit, which is unfair to users.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: Functions' visibility should be changed to external if they are not called from any internal function.
